intro: Cerastium huadingense, commonly known as the Hua Ding Enigma, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, commonly known as the carnation family. The plant features small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky habitats.
